result.execSummary:
The defendant John Richard Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
Case #14 CF 071 placed on deferred entry agreement for 30 mos (see attached).

miscConds.notes:
While on supervision the Defendant is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Courts Office, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Clerk of Circuit Court Ashland County
201 West Main Street, Room 307
Ashland,WI  54806
To seek, obtain and maintain full time employment/full time schooling or a combination of the two.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, or any mind altering substances(MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Defendant, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores,(any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol), any place where mind altering substances are present, consumed or sold..
  The Defendant is to take all his/her prescribed medications as prescribed by treating physician and all prescribed medication(s) taken only as prescribed!
Def to obtain a mental health assessment & follow thru with all recommendations.
  The Defendant is to obtain counseling as directed by DOC at the expense of the Defendant.
Def to have NO CONTACT w/co-def's (may have limited contact w/Connie Denomie for purposes relating to child care.
  The Defendant is to provide a DNA specimen.
  The Defendant is to enroll in and successfully complete the Ashland Adult Drug Court Program.
  The Defendant, being found guilty of a felony or other crime specified in sub.(1) under Wisconsin statutes Sect. 941.29 under the Wisconsin Criminal Code of requirements and penalties.
   " A person subject to the requirements and penalties is prohibited from possessing, receiving,
     obtaining a firearm/body armor." 

NOTE:  Under Wisconsin State Statute 6.03(1)(b) a person found guilty of a felony that you are ineligible to vote in any election until your civil rights are restored!
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

timeConds.notes:
Credit for time served.
NOTE:  the balance of 138 days is STAYED - pending participation & successful completion of Ashland Co Adult Drug Ct.  If successfully graduates fr Drug Ct the remainder of the jail time will be vacated.
AMENDED 12/22/15 - Def successfully completed Ash Co Adult Drug Ct - Ct amends jail time (completed).

Financial obligations as previously ordered (paid in full).
  Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

records.addlTxt: correspondence between Judge and Attorneys

Defendant John Richard Johnson in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kimberly Lawton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF71 and 14CF127. State req 14CF71 12yr 5IN 7ES, 14CF127 5yr 2IN 3ES CS, comments on sentencing of coactors, comments on Def  sentencing, Spec Pros agrees with PSI, vic rights satisfied. Atty Perrine arguement, clearly prison case, revoked on Bayfield co case IS, sentence(s) should be concurrent to Bayfield co case, 14CF71 rec 7yr 3IN 4ES, 14CF127 2yr 1IN 1ES, CC and concurrent with Bayfield co case. Spec Pros disagrees beleives should be CS. Atty Perrine 14CF127 568 CTS, 14CF71 at least 436CTS plus initial confinement, has requested cts info from the jail but does not have it at this time, argues for lesser period of incarceration. Parties agree to 568 days CTS. Def comments. 
Ct comments. Orders 14CF71 12yrs 5IN 7ES, 14CF127 5yrs 2IN 3ES CS to 14CF71 and CS to Bayfield CO cases 568 CTS, absol, cog, aoda, couns, cc each, remanded.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Richard Johnson in court with attorney Mark L Perrine.  Kelly J Mcknight appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2 cases. DEJ on 14Cf71 has been revoked, PSI filed. DA no corrections to PSI, has issue he wishes to raise with the court before proceeding. DA def had been Drg Ct and TAD participant, cases for sentencing today are the cases that he was in Drg ct and TAD for, uncomfortable with handling sentencing asks court to recuse itself from sentencing and intends to ask for a special prosecutor to prosecute. Atty Perrine understands DAs position would prefer to proceed are prepared to waive the conflict. Judge is going to recuse himself in each case. Does not want any reason to second guess judgment.

Attorney Mark L Perrine in court.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 14CF127 and 14CF71. Atty Perrine motion for entry of judgment on 14CF71. Defendant John Richard Johnson appeared by video means. DEJ on 14CF71. State has filed a motion that he has not completed. Atty Perrine acknowledges that he has not complied. Ct finds beyond a reasonable doubt that has not completed DEJ  Ct adjudges Convicted of Conspiring to Deliver Meth. Atty Perrine requests another sentencing date. State requests PSI. Ct grants request for PSI applicable on both cases.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 6, 2017 at 02:00 pm.
